PERSONA:
Emily Wilson, a 28-year-old White female, born in Oregon but currently residing in Casper, Wyoming. She is a widow, having lost her husband two years ago in a work-related accident. Emily is a high school sweetheart who married her husband right after graduation and moved to Wyoming for his job. She has a graduate degree in Environmental Science from the University of Wyoming, which she obtained through online courses while working part-time jobs.

Emily works as a janitor at the local Natrona County School District, earning an annual income of $19,500. Despite her graduate degree, she hasn't been able to secure a job in her field of study due to the limited job market in Casper. She is fluent in English and has no proficiency in any other language.

Emily lives in a small, rented apartment in the downtown area of Casper, paying $800 per month in rent. She does not have health insurance, relying on community clinics and emergency services when needed. Her economic concerns include affording healthcare, saving for the future, and finding a better-paying job that aligns with her education and skills.

As a widow, Emily's primary focus is on rebuilding her life and creating a stable future. She is concerned about the lack of job opportunities in her field and the high cost of living in Wyoming. Her experience with the healthcare system has also made her an advocate for affordable healthcare options. Emily's economic priorities include increasing the minimum wage, improving access to affordable healthcare, and promoting education and job training programs that address the needs of the local economy.
